   21: %%
   22: -module(ssh_to_openssh_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include("ssh_test_lib.hrl").
   26: -include("ssh_transport.hrl").
   27: 
   28: -export([
   29:          suite/0,
   30:          all/0,
   31:          groups/0,
   32:          init_per_suite/1,
   33:          end_per_suite/1,
   34:          init_per_group/2,
   35:          end_per_group/2,
   36:          init_per_testcase/2,
   37:          end_per_testcase/2
   38:         ]).
   39: 
   40: -export([
   41:          erlang_server_openssh_client_renegotiate/1,
   42:          eserver_oclient_kex_strict/1,
   43:          erlang_shell_client_openssh_server/1,
   44:          eclient_oserver_kex_strict/1,
   45:          exec_direct_with_io_in_sshc/1,
   46:          exec_with_io_in_sshc/1,
   47:          tunnel_in_erlclient_erlserver/1,
   48:          tunnel_in_erlclient_openssh_server/1,
   49:          tunnel_in_non_erlclient_erlserver/1,
   50:          tunnel_out_erlclient_erlserver/1,
   51:          tunnel_out_erlclient_openssh_server/1,
   52:          tunnel_out_non_erlclient_erlserver/1
   53: 
   54:         ]).
   55: 
   56: -define(REKEY_DATA_TMO, 65000).
   57: 
   58: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   59: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   60: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   61: 
   62: suite() ->
   63:     [{timetrap,{seconds,60}}].
   64: 
   65: all() -> 
   66:     case os:find_executable("ssh") of
   67: 	false -> 
   68: 	    {skip, "openSSH not installed on host"};
   69: 	_ ->
   70: 	    [{group, erlang_client},
   71:              {group, erlang_server}
   72: 	     ]
   73:     end.
   74: 
   75: groups() -> 
   76:     [{erlang_client, [], [tunnel_in_erlclient_erlserver,
   77:                           tunnel_out_erlclient_erlserver,
   78:                           {group, tunnel_distro_server},
   79:                           erlang_shell_client_openssh_server,
   80:                           eclient_oserver_kex_strict
   81: 			 ]},
   82:      {tunnel_distro_server, [], [tunnel_in_erlclient_openssh_server,
   83:                                  tunnel_out_erlclient_openssh_server]},
   84:      {erlang_server, [], [{group, tunnel_distro_client},
   85:                           erlang_server_openssh_client_renegotiate,
   86:                           eserver_oclient_kex_strict,
   87:                           exec_with_io_in_sshc,
   88:                           exec_direct_with_io_in_sshc
   89:                          ]
   90:      },
   91:      {tunnel_distro_client, [], [tunnel_in_non_erlclient_erlserver,
   92:                                  tunnel_out_non_erlclient_erlserver]}
   93:     ].
   94: 
   95: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   96:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
   97:        case gen_tcp:connect("localhost", ?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active, false}]) of
   98: 	   {error,econnrefused} ->
   99: 	       {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  100: 	   {ok, Sock} ->
  101:                ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(
  102:                  [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()},
  103:                   {kex_strict, check_kex_strict(Sock)}| Config0])
  104:        end
  105:       ).
  106: 
  107: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  108:     ok.
  109: 
  110: init_per_group(erlang_server, Config) ->
  111:     Config;
  112: init_per_group(G, Config) when G==tunnel_distro_server ;
  113:                                G==tunnel_distro_client ->
  114:     case no_forwarding(Config) of
  115:         true ->
  116:             {skip, "port forwarding disabled in external ssh"};
  117:         false ->
  118:             Config
  119:     end;
  120: init_per_group(erlang_client, Config) ->
  121:     CommonAlgs = ssh_test_lib:algo_intersection(
  122: 		   ssh:default_algorithms(),
  123: 		   ssh_test_lib:default_algorithms(sshd)),
  124:     [{common_algs,CommonAlgs} | Config];
  125: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  126:     Config.
  127: 
  128: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  129:     Config.
  130: 
  131: 
  132: init_per_testcase(erlang_server_openssh_client_renegotiate, Config) ->
  133:     case os:type() of
  134: 	{unix,_} ->
  135:             ssh:start(),
  136:             ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config);
  137: 	Type ->
  138:             {skip, io_lib:format("Unsupported test on ~p",[Type])}
  139:     end;
  140: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  141:     ssh:start(),
  142:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config).
  143: 
  144: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
  145:     ssh:stop(),
  146:     ok.
  147: 
  148: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  149: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  150: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  151: erlang_shell_client_openssh_server(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  152:     eclient_oserver_helper2(eclient_oserver_helper1(), Config).
  153: 
  154: eclient_oserver_kex_strict(Config) when is_list(Config)->
  155:     case proplists:get_value(kex_strict, Config) of
  156:         true ->
  157:             {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  158:             Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  159:             ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  160:             HelperParams = eclient_oserver_helper1(),
  161:             {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  162:             true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  163:             ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  164:             ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  165:             eclient_oserver_helper2(HelperParams, Config);
  166:         _ ->
  167:             {skip, "KEX strict not support by local OpenSSH"}
  168:     end.
  169: 
  170: eclient_oserver_helper1() ->
  171:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  172:     IO = ssh_test_lib:start_io_server(),
  173:     Prev = lists:usort(supervisor:which_children(sshc_sup)),
  174:     Shell = ssh_test_lib:start_shell(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, IO),
  175:     {Shell, Prev, IO}.
  176: 
  177: eclient_oserver_helper2({Shell, Prev, IO}, Config) ->
  178:     IO ! {input, self(), "echo Hej\n"},
  179:     case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  180:         true ->
  181:             ct:log("~p:~p  ptty supported", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  182:             receive_data("Hej", undefined),
  183:             IO ! {input, self(), "exit\n"},
  184:             receive_logout(),
  185:             receive_normal_exit(Shell),
  186:             %% Check that the connection is closed:
  187:             ct:log("Expects ~p", [Prev]),
  188:             ?wait_match(Prev, lists:usort(supervisor:which_children(sshc_sup)));
  189:         false ->
  190:             ct:log("~p:~p  ptty unsupported", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  191:             receive_exit(Shell,
  192:                          fun({{badmatch,failure},
  193:                               [{ssh,shell,_,_} | _]}) -> true;
  194:                             (_) ->
  195:                                  false
  196:                          end)
  197:     end.
  198: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  199: %% Test that the server could redirect stdin and stdout from/to an
  200: %% OpensSSH client when handling an exec request
  201: exec_with_io_in_sshc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  202:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  203:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},
  204:                                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  205:     ct:sleep(500),
  206: 
  207:     _PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  208:     ExecStr = "\"io:read('% ').\"",
  209:     Cmd =  "echo howdy. | " ++ ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  210:                                                           [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  211:                                                            " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  212:                                                            " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  213:                                                            " -q"
  214:                                                            " -x" % Disable X forwarding
  215:                                                           ],
  216:                                                           ExecStr),
  217:     ct:log("Cmd = ~p~n",[Cmd]),
  218:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  219:         "% {ok,howdy}" -> ok;
  220:         "{ok,howdy}% " -> ok; % Could happen if the client sends the piped
  221:                               % input before receiving the prompt ("% ").
  222:         Other -> ct:fail("Received ~p",[Other])
  223:     end,
  224:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  225: 
  226: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  227: %% Test that the server could redirect stdin and stdout from/to an
  228: %% OpensSSH client when handling an direct exec request
  229: exec_direct_with_io_in_sshc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  230:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  231:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},
  232:                                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2},
  233:                                              {exec,{direct,fun(Cmnd) ->
  234:                                                                    {ok,X} = io:read(Cmnd),
  235:                                                                    {ok,{X,lists:reverse(atom_to_list(X))}}
  236:                                                            end}}
  237:                                             ]),
  238:     ct:sleep(500),
  239: 
  240:     _PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  241:     Cmd =  "echo ciao. | " ++ ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  242:                                                           [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  243:                                                            " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  244:                                                            " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  245:                                                            " -q"
  246:                                                            " -x" % Disable X forwarding
  247:                                                           ],
  248:                                                          "'? '"),
  249:     ct:log("Cmd = ~p~n",[Cmd]),
  250:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  251:         "? {ciao,\"oaic\"}" -> ok;
  252:         "'? '{ciao,\"oaic\"}" -> ok; % WSL
  253:         "{ciao,\"oaic\"}? " -> ok; % Could happen if the client sends the piped
  254:                                    % input before receiving the prompt ("? ").
  255:         Other -> ct:fail("Received ~p",[Other])
  256:     end,
  257:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  258: 
  259: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  260: %% Test that the Erlang/OTP server can renegotiate with openSSH
  261: erlang_server_openssh_client_renegotiate(Config) ->
  262:     eserver_oclient_renegotiate_helper2(
  263:       eserver_oclient_renegotiate_helper1(Config)).
  264: 
  265: eserver_oclient_kex_strict(Config) ->
  266:     case proplists:get_value(kex_strict, Config) of
  267:         true ->
  268:             {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  269:             Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  270:             ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  271: 
  272:             HelperParams = eserver_oclient_renegotiate_helper1(Config),
  273:             {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  274:             ct:log("Events = ~n~p", [Events]),
  275:             true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  276:             ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  277:             ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  278:             eserver_oclient_renegotiate_helper2(HelperParams);
  279:         _ ->
  280:             {skip, "KEX strict not support by local OpenSSH"}
  281:     end.
  282: 
  283: eserver_oclient_renegotiate_helper1(Config) ->
  284:     _PubKeyAlg = ssh_rsa,
  285:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  286:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  287: 
  288:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},
  289:                                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  290:     ct:sleep(500),
  291: 
  292:     RenegLimitK = 3,
  293:     DataFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "renegotiate_openssh_client.data"),
  294:     Data =  lists:duplicate(trunc(1.1*RenegLimitK*1024), $a),
  295:     ok = file:write_file(DataFile, Data),
  296: 
  297:     Cmd = ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  298:                                      [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  299:                                       " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  300:                                       " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  301:                                       " -q"
  302:                                       " -x",
  303:                                       " -o RekeyLimit=",integer_to_list(RenegLimitK),"K"]),
  304: 
  305: 
  306:     OpenSsh = ssh_test_lib:open_port({spawn, Cmd++" < "++DataFile}),
  307:     {Data, OpenSsh, Pid}.
  308: 
  309: eserver_oclient_renegotiate_helper2({Data, OpenSsh, Pid}) ->
  310:     Expect = fun({data,R}) ->
  311: 		     try
  312: 			 NonAlphaChars = [C || C<-lists:seq(1,255),
  313: 					       not lists:member(C,lists:seq($a,$z)),
  314: 					       not lists:member(C,lists:seq($A,$Z))
  315: 					 ],
  316: 			 Lines = string:tokens(binary_to_list(R), NonAlphaChars),
  317: 			 lists:any(fun(L) -> length(L)>1 andalso lists:prefix(L, Data) end,
  318: 				   Lines)
  319: 		     catch
  320: 			 _:_ -> false
  321: 		     end;
  322: 
  323: 		({exit_status,E}) when E=/=0 ->
  324: 		     ct:log("exit_status ~p",[E]),
  325: 		     throw({skip,"exit status"});
  326: 
  327: 		(_) ->
  328: 		     false
  329: 	     end,
  330:     try
  331:         ssh_test_lib:rcv_expected(Expect, OpenSsh, ?TIMEOUT)
  332:     of
  333:         _ ->
  334:             %% Unfortunately we can't check that there has been a renegotiation, just trust OpenSSH.
  335:             ssh:stop_daemon(Pid)
  336:     catch
  337:         throw:{skip,R} -> {skip,R}
  338:     end.
  339: 
  340: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  341: tunnel_out_non_erlclient_erlserver(Config) ->
  342:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  343:     _PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  344: 
  345:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{tcpip_tunnel_out, true},
  346:                                              {system_dir, SystemDir},
  347:                                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  348:     {ToSock, _ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  349: 
  350:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  351:     ListenPort = 2345,
  352: 
  353:     Cmd = ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  354:                                      [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  355:                                       " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  356:                                       " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  357:                                       " -q"
  358:                                       " -x",
  359:                                       " -R ",integer_to_list(ListenPort),":127.0.0.1:",integer_to_list(ToPort)]),
  360:     spawn(fun() ->
  361:                   ct:log(["ssh command:\r\n  ",Cmd],[]),
  362:                   R = os:cmd(Cmd),
  363:                   ct:log(["ssh returned:\r\n",R],[])
  364:           end),
  365: 
  366:     ct:sleep(1000),
  367:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  368:     
  369: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  370: tunnel_in_non_erlclient_erlserver(Config) ->
  371:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  372:     _UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  373:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{tcpip_tunnel_in, true},
  374:                                               {system_dir, SystemDir},
  375:                                               {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  376:     {ToSock, _ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  377:     
  378:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  379:     ListenPort = 2345,
  380: 
  381:     Cmd =
  382:         ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  383:                                    [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  384:                                     " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  385:                                     " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  386:                                     " -q"
  387:                                     " -x",
  388:                                     " -L ",integer_to_list(ListenPort),":127.0.0.1:",integer_to_list(ToPort)]),
  389:     spawn(fun() ->
  390:                   ct:log(["ssh command:\r\n  ",Cmd],[]),
  391:                   R = os:cmd(Cmd),
  392:                   ct:log(["ssh returned:\r\n",R],[])
  393:           end),
  394:     ct:sleep(1000),
  395:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  396: 
  397: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  398: tunnel_in_erlclient_erlserver(Config) ->
  399:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  400:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  401:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{tcpip_tunnel_in, true},
  402:                                               {system_dir, SystemDir},
  403:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
  404:                                               {user_passwords, [{"foo", "bar"}]},
  405:                                               {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  406:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  407:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
  408:                                           {user,"foo"},{password,"bar"},
  409:                                           {user_interaction, false}]),
  410:     {ToSock, ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  411:     
  412:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  413:     {ok,ListenPort} = ssh:tcpip_tunnel_to_server(C, ListenHost,0, ToHost,ToPort, 2000),
  414: 
  415:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  416: 
  417: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  418: tunnel_in_erlclient_openssh_server(_Config) ->
  419:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  420:     {ToSock, ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  421:     
  422:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  423:     {ok,ListenPort} = ssh:tcpip_tunnel_to_server(C, ListenHost,0, ToHost,ToPort, 5000),
  424: 
  425:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  426: 
  427: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  428: tunnel_out_erlclient_erlserver(Config) ->
  429:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  430:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  431:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{tcpip_tunnel_out, true},
  432:                                               {system_dir, SystemDir},
  433:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
  434:                                               {user_passwords, [{"foo", "bar"}]},
  435:                                               {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  436:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  437:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
  438:                                           {user,"foo"},{password,"bar"},
  439:                                           {user_interaction, false}]),
  440:     {ToSock, ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  441:     
  442:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  443:     {ok,ListenPort} = ssh:tcpip_tunnel_from_server(C, ListenHost,0, ToHost,ToPort, 5000),
  444: 
  445:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  446: 
  447: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  448: tunnel_out_erlclient_openssh_server(_Config) ->
  449:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  450:     {ToSock, ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  451:     
  452:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  453:     {ok,ListenPort} = ssh:tcpip_tunnel_from_server(C, ListenHost,0, ToHost,ToPort, 5000),
  454: 
  455:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  456: 
  457: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  458: %%% Internal functions -----------------------------------------------
  459: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  460: tunneling_listner() ->
  461:     {ok,LSock} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
  462:     {ok, {LHost,LPort}} = inet:sockname(LSock),
  463:     {LSock, LHost, LPort}.
  464: 
  465: test_tunneling(ListenSocket, Host, Port) ->
  466:     {ok,Client1} = gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
  467:     {ok,Server1} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket),
  468:     {ok,Client2} = gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
  469:     {ok,Server2} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket),
  470:     send_rcv("Hi!", Client1, Server1),
  471:     send_rcv("Happy to see you!", Server1, Client1),
  472:     send_rcv("Hi, you to!", Client2, Server2),
  473:     send_rcv("Happy to see you also!", Server2, Client2),
  474:     close_and_check(Client1, Server1),
  475:     send_rcv("Still there?", Client2, Server2),
  476:     send_rcv("Yes!", Server2, Client2),
  477:     close_and_check(Server2, Client2).
  478:     
  479:     
  480: close_and_check(OneSide, OtherSide) ->
  481:     ok = gen_tcp:close(OneSide),
  482:     ok = chk_closed(OtherSide).
  483:     
  484:     
  485: chk_closed(Sock) ->
  486:     chk_closed(Sock, 0).
  487: chk_closed(Sock, Timeout) ->
  488:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0, Timeout) of
  489:         {error,closed} ->
  490:             ok;
  491:         {error,timeout} ->
  492:             chk_closed(Sock, 2*max(Timeout,250));
  493:         Other ->
  494:             Other
  495:     end.
  496:     
  497: send_rcv(Txt, From, To) ->
  498:     ct:log("Send ~p from ~p to ~p", [Txt, From, To]),
  499:     ok = gen_tcp:send(From, Txt),
  500:     ct:log("Recv ~p on ~p", [Txt, To]),
  501:     {ok,Txt} = gen_tcp:recv(To, 0, 5000),
  502:     ok.    
  503: 
  504: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  505: receive_data(Data, Conn) ->
  506:     receive
  507: 	Info when is_binary(Info) ->
  508: 	    Lines = string:tokens(binary_to_list(Info), "\r\n "),
  509: 	    case lists:member(Data, Lines) of
  510: 		true ->
  511: 		    ct:log("~p:~p  Expected result ~p found in lines: ~p~n", [?MODULE,?LINE,Data,Lines]),
  512: 		    ok;
  513: 		false ->
  514: 		    ct:log("~p:~p  Extra info: ~p~n", [?MODULE,?LINE,Info]),
  515: 		    receive_data(Data, Conn)
  516: 	    end;
  517: 	Other ->
  518: 	    ct:log("~p:~p  Unexpected: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  519: 	    receive_data(Data, Conn)
  520:     after
  521: 	30000 ->
  522:              {State, _} = case Conn of
  523:                               undefined -> {'??','??'};
  524:                               _ -> sys:get_state(Conn)
  525:                           end,
  526:             ct:log("timeout ~p:~p~nExpect ~p~nState = ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Data,State]),
  527:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  528:     end.	
  529: 
  530: receive_logout() ->
  531:     receive
  532: 	<<"logout">> ->
  533: 	    extra_logout(),
  534: 	    receive
  535: 		<<"Connection closed">> ->
  536: 		    ok
  537: 	    after 
  538: 		30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  539: 	    end;
  540: 	Info ->
  541: 	    ct:log("Extra info when logging out: ~p~n", [Info]),
  542: 	    receive_logout()
  543:     after 
  544: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  545:     end.
  546: 
  547: 
  548: receive_normal_exit(Shell) ->
  549:     receive_exit(Shell, fun(Reason) -> Reason == normal end).
  550: 
  551: 
  552: receive_exit(Shell, F) when is_function(F,1) ->
  553:     receive
  554:         {'EXIT', Shell, Reason} ->
  555:             case F(Reason) of
  556:                 true ->
  557:                     ok;
  558:                 false ->
  559:                     ct:fail({unexpected_exit, Reason})
  560:             end;
  561: 
  562:         <<"\r\n">> ->
  563:             receive_normal_exit(Shell);
  564: 
  565:         Other ->
  566:             ct:fail({unexpected_msg, Other})
  567: 
  568:         after 
  569: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  570:     end.
  571: 
  572: 
  573: extra_logout() ->
  574:     receive 	
  575: 	<<"logout">> ->
  576: 	    ok
  577:     after 500 -> 
  578: 	    ok
  579:     end.
  580: 
  581: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  582: no_forwarding(Config) ->
  583:     %%% Check if the ssh of the OS has tunneling enabled
  584:     _UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  585:     Cmnd = ["ssh "
  586:             " -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  587:             " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  588:             " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  589:             " -R 0:localhost:4567 localhost exit"],
  590:     FailRegExp =
  591:         "Port forwarding is disabled"
  592:         "|remote port forwarding failed"
  593:         "|Bad.*specification"
  594:         "|Bad forwarding port",
  595:     {Result,TheText} =
  596:         try
  597:             Parent = self(),
  598:             Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  599:                                 Parent ! {self(), os:cmd(Cmnd)}
  600:                         end),
  601:             receive
  602:                 {Pid, Txt} ->
  603:                     case re:run(Txt, FailRegExp) of
  604:                         {match,_} -> {true,Txt};
  605:                         _ -> {false,Txt}
  606:                 end
  607:         after 10000 ->
  608:                 ct:log("*** TIMEOUT ***",[]),
  609:                 {true,""}
  610:         end
  611:     catch C:E:S ->
  612:             ct:log("Exception in no_forwarding():~n~p:~p~n~p~n", [C,E,S]),
  613:             {true, ""}
  614:     end,
  615:     ct:log("---- os:cmd(~p) returned:~n~s~n"
  616:            "~n"
  617:            "---- Checking with regexp~n"
  618:            "~p~n"
  619:            "~n"
  620:            "---- The function no_forwarding() returns ~p",
  621:            [Cmnd,TheText, FailRegExp, Result]),
  622:     Result.
  623: 
  624: check_kex_strict(Sock) ->
  625:     %% Send some version, in order to receive KEXINIT from server
  626:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, "SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_9.5\r\n"),
  627:     ct:sleep(100),
  628:     {ok, Packet} = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
  629:     case string:find(Packet, ?kex_strict_s) of
  630:         nomatch ->
  631:             ct:log("KEX strict NOT supported by local OpenSSH"),
  632:             false;
  633:         _ ->
  634:             ct:log("KEX strict supported by local OpenSSH"),
  635:             true
  636:     end.
  637:
